questions.text: Identify the image:

A 34-year-old HIV-positive male presents with lesions on his skin as shown below, along with signs of hepatosplenomegaly. His CD4 count is critically low. Which of the following organisms is most likely responsible for his condition?
What is the aim of the following program?

options.label: A
options.text: To improve the cleanliness, hygiene of public health facilities

options.label: B
options.text: Provides health care to senior citizens

options.label: C
options.text: Plant more trees in government institutes

questions.correct_answer: A. To improve the cleanliness, hygiene of public health facilities
questions.explanation: Ans. A) To improve the cleanliness, hygiene of public health facilities

questions.text: Which of the following vaccines is administered intradermally in the right upper arm during infancy?
Identify the correct statement:

options.label: A
options.text: Safe motherhood services and cash for institutional delivery - Surakshit Matritva Abhiyan

options.label: B
options.text: Designed for training health personnel - Navjat Sishu Suraksha Karyakaram

options.label: C
options.text: Freedays by ASHA to adolescents - Kishori shakti yojana

questions.correct_answer: B. Designed for training health personnel - Navjat Sishu Suraksha Karyakaram
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Designed for training health personnel - Navjat Sishu Suraksha Karyakaram

questions.text: A 47-year-old male presents with erythematous, shallow erosions accompanied by blisters and yellowish scales, localized to seborrheic regions such as the face, chest, and upper back. There is no involvement of the oral mucosa. A skin biopsy with immunopathology reveals IgG deposition on keratinocytes. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Local anesthesia used in cataract surgery is:
What is the correct sequence of steps in a randomized controlled trial? Blinding Randomization Defining inclusion and exclusion criteria Statistical analysis
A virologist is investigating different strains of the Ebola virus. Which strain is recognized as non-pathogenic to humans?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Reston

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Among the six known viruses (Zaire, Sudan, Taï Forest, Reston, Bundibugyo and Cote d’Ivoire) within the genus Ebolavirus; Reston virus causes disease in non-human primates. Unlike the other five Ebolaviruses, it is not known to cause disease in humans, but has caused asymptomatic infections.

questions.text: A 43-year-old male presents to the OPD due to fever and a right foot lesion. The lesion was erythematous and edematous, but it quickly developed into a bulla surrounded by erythema. Eventually, the bulla ruptured, leaving a painless ulcer with a black center. The patient has a history of non-Hodgkin lymphoma and recently underwent chemotherapy. Which of the following is the best treatment for this patient’s foot lesion?

A study assessed the association between a new vaccine and traveler's diarrhea (TD). Researchers selected a random sample of people who intended to travel to regions where they were at increased risk for TD and who had received the new vaccine and another independent random sample of people who intended to travel to the same regions and who had not received the new vaccine. These 2 samples of travelers were assessed for the occurrence of TD during the trip and for 7 days after returning home. Which of the following measures of association are the investigators most likely to report?

A 32-year-old woman comes to the OPD due to a small amount of malodorous vaginal discharge. She is sexually active with a male partner and uses condoms sporadically. She drinks a glass of wine every night with dinner and has had an abnormal Pap test in the past. Speculum examination reveals thin, gray discharge. Wet mount microscopy of the discharge shows large, atypical vaginal epithelial cells and no protozoa. Application of potassium hydroxide solution to the discharge yields a strong odor. Which of the following is the best treatment option for this patient?
A 55-year-old man with HIV comes to the physician because of multiple lesions on his chest and lower extremities. Which of the following is the most appropriate pharmacotherapy?
The following are useful in the measurement of the index shown in the image: PM10 PM5 NO2 SO2 O3 Lead PM2.5
A 28-year-old pregnant woman employed in a garment factory is entitled to specific benefits under the ESI scheme. Which of the following correctly describes the maternity benefit provision?

options.label: A
options.text: Full wages for 91 days after delivery

options.label: B
options.text: Full wages for 26 weeks for pregnancy and childbirth, including a premature delivery

options.label: C
options.text: 80% of daily wages for 14 days post-tubectomy

options.label: D
options.text: 90% of wages as a pension for the dependents of the insured person

questions.correct_answer: B. Full wages for 26 weeks for pregnancy and childbirth, including a premature delivery
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Full wages for 26 weeks for pregnancy and childbirth, including a premature delivery

questions.text: All of the following statements are true about CPR Brachial artery is the preferred pulse for assessment in an infant Adequate rate of CC is 100-120/min 120-200J energy is delivered in a biphasic defribrillator Intra-venous, intra-osseous or intra-tracheal route may be used for epinephrine
Identify the disease transmitted by the vector shown in the image.
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Zika virus disease

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Aedes aegypti is the vector responsible for transmitting diseases such as Zika virus, dengue, chikungunya, and yellow fever. It is characterized by white stripes on its body and legs and typically breeds in man-made water collections.

questions.text: You are leading a seminar on obesity assessment methods for healthcare professionals, emphasizing the importance of using internationally accepted standards. You present information on various indices used to measure obesity and ask the participants to identify the internationally accepted method for measuring obesity. Which of the following methods is internationally accepted for measuring obesity?
A 50-year-old female is undergoing breast chemotherapy. Following this there was diffuse hair loss noted. What is the most likely diagnosis?

You are drawing blood sample for serum calcium. Which of the following is to be avoided to prevent false/erroneous reporting of calcium values: Collection in sodium citrate vial Forearm exercise and fist clenching Prolonged immobilization of patient Rapid removal of tourniquet

A hospital administration committee is planning to implement a new protocol for emergency department triage. They wish to involve multiple experts to reach a consensus on the most effective approach. Which of the following methods is most likely to ensure an unbiased, collective agreement among the experts?

options.label: A
options.text: Focus group discussions with open-ended debates

options.label: B
options.text: Delphi method using structured questionnaires over multiple rounds

options.label: C
options.text: Randomized controlled trials to validate the protocol

options.label: D
options.text: Individual interviews with each expert to finalize the protocol

questions.correct_answer: B. Delphi method using structured questionnaires over multiple rounds
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Delphi method is an interactive forecasting tool used to achieve consensus among experts through multiple rounds of structured questionnaires.
  • ➤ The Delphi method is an interactive forecasting tool used to achieve consensus among experts through multiple rounds of structured questionnaires.

questions.text: A nutritionist is evaluating the mid-day meal scheme provided in upper primary schools to ensure the dietary intake meets the needs of the students. According to the guidelines, what is the recommended quality per child for upper primary school students except?
In a patient undergoing cataract surgery, which of the following is the most important strategy in the prevention of postoperative endophthalmitis?

options.label: B
options.text: Prophylactic antibiotic 1 hour prior to surgery

questions.correct_answer: A. Preoperative preparation with povidone iodine
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Preoperative preparation with povidone iodine

questions.text: A 25-year-old male presents to the clinic with complaints of dysuria and urethral discharge. Upon further questioning, he reports recent unprotected sexual intercourse. A urethral swab is taken for Gram stain and culture. Which of the following organisms is least likely to cause urethritis in this patient?
What will be the 95% confidence interval (CI) for an estimated prevalence of 10% and a sample size of 100?

options.label: D
options.text: Given data inadequate for calculation of class intervals

questions.text: A 50-year-old female patient with HIV infection is started on antiretroviral therapy. After a year of treatment, the patient develops back pain. X-ray LS spine is shown below. Which of the following antiretroviral drugs could be the potential cause of these symptoms?
A 45-year-old male with Type II Diabetes is posted for surgery. His HbA1c is 8. What is his ASA-physical status classification?
Under the National Urban Health Mission (NUHM), Urban Social Health Activist (USHA) workers are assigned to cater to a population of:
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Urban Social Health Activists (USHA) serve as a crucial link between the UPHC and the urban slum population, covering 1000–2500 people (250–500 households) , as specified by the NUHM guidelines.
  • ➤ Urban Social Health Activists (USHA) serve as a crucial link between the UPHC and the urban slum population, covering 1000–2500 people (250–500 households) , as specified by the NUHM guidelines.
  • ➤ 1000–2500 people (250–500 households)

questions.text: A 58 yr old male presents to the clinic for evaluation of skin lesions that seem to have developed over the last few weeks. The patient has worked as a farmer for the past 30 years. He is unable to work for as long as he used to about a year ago. He has lost 9 kgs in 3 months and he says his appetite is decreased as he feels full after eating a short meal and attributes this to ageing. On examination, multiple waxy 1-5mm in diameter lesions are noted over the back and abdomen. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis, given the examination finding?
Identify the incorrect pair: Benefit measured in terms of natural units - Cost benefit analysis Method based on behavioral sciences - MBO CPM - Network Analysis ICER - Cost benefit analysis
Identify the incorrect statement about family structure:

options.label: A
options.text: Nuclear family: a family consisting of a mother, a father and their children

options.label: C
options.text: Joint family: It consists of a number of married couples and their children living in the same household and all the men in the household are related by blood

options.label: D
options.text: Three generation family: It occurs when the married children of a couple continue to stay with their parents and have their own children.

questions.text: Identify the incorrect pair:

A 46-year-old man comes to the physician for a pre-employment wellness examination. A tuberculin skin test is administered and he develops a raised, erythematous 12 mm lesion on his forearm within 48 hours. An x-ray of the chest shows no abnormalities. He is started on the recommended antibiotic treatment for latent tuberculosis. Four weeks later, he returns for a follow-up examination. Laboratory studies show a hemoglobin concentration of 9.3 g/dL, serum alanine aminotransferase activity of 86 U/L, and serum aspartate aminotransferase activity of 66 U/L. A photomicrograph of a Prussian blue-stained bone marrow smear is shown. Which of the following is the mechanism of action of the drug responsible for this patient's findings?
questions.correct_answer: C. Inhibition of mycolic acid synthesis
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Inhibition of mycolic acid synthesis

questions.text: The prevalence of a chronic disease that affects mostly older individuals has been constant in a population for the last 15 years. As a result of worsening economic conditions that have no effect on the disease itself, many young healthy individuals emigrate from the population. Which of the following is the most likely effect of the emigration on the estimate of disease prevalence over the next few years?

options.label: C
options.text: The prevalence would remain the same

options.label: D
options.text: It is not possible to determine the effect on prevalence from the information given

questions.text: A pharmacist selects randomly from three groups of medicines of ‘plant-based’, ‘animal-derived’ and ‘synthetics’. What kind of sampling is this?
The Stanford Three-Community Study, the North Karelia Project, and the Lipid Research Clinics Study are well-known research efforts. What type of study design best describes these efforts?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Stanford Three-Community Study, North Karelia Project, and Lipid Research Clinics Study are risk factor intervention trials focused on reducing health risks through targeted interventions, rather than merely observing outcomes.
  • ➤ The Stanford Three-Community Study, North Karelia Project, and Lipid Research Clinics Study are risk factor intervention trials focused on reducing health risks through targeted interventions, rather than merely observing outcomes.

questions.text: Identify the correct statements Under Ayushman Bharat Scheme, a family can get upto 10lakh per year as insurance. Recent transmission of malaria can be calculated from API In villages, first contact of people to medical health care is PHC Low air velocity is measured by Kata thermometer
Identify the incorrect match:

Researchers studying the effects of hormone replacement therapy (HRT) on the risk of myocardial infarction (Ml) among postmenopausal women calculate the relative risk (RR) of Ml to be 1.30 (p = 0.07) among women who are taking HRT compared to those who are not. The researchers conclude that there is no statistically significant increased risk of Ml with HRT. Subsequently, the results of a meta-analysis determine that there actually is an increased risk of Ml, with an overall RR= 1.32 (p = 0.03) among postmenopausal women who are taking HRT compared to those who are not. Which of the following was the most likely problem in the first study?
Identify the correct pair of BMW management: Human waste - Incineration Urobag - Microwave Vacutainer - Recycling Chemicals - Collect in chlorinated containers and send for disposal

A new rapid test for the diagnosis of a viral respiratory infection is evaluated in 200 study participants. At a given cutoff, the test shows a true-negative rate of approximately 70% and a true-positive rate of approximately 65%. Which of the following labeled graphs is most likely to represent this diagnostic test?
What is the relieving pressure of the pressure release valve in the following device?
A patient was given a local anesthetic before IV cannulation as shown below. Which among the following statements is true regarding the anaesthetic?

options.label: A
options.text: 1 gm of 0.5% of cream contains 50 mg lignocaine

options.label: D
options.text: It is made of lignocaine and ropivacaine

questions.correct_answer: B. Methemoglobinemia is a side effect
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Methemoglobinemia is a side effect

questions.text: A 33-year-old man comes to the physician for evaluation of progressive hair loss from his scalp. Examination is shown below. Administration of which of the following drugs is most appropriate to treat this patient's hair loss?

Identify the correct statements: Role of Social factors in Disease causation is studied under Social Pathology Death should be registered within 21 days Birth dose of BCG is 0.05 ml intra-dermal Base of a population pyramid denotes fertility

A 45-year-old male is brought to the ICU after a severe traumatic brain injury following a road traffic accident. He is unresponsive, with no spontaneous movements or brainstem reflexes on examination. Mechanical ventilation is maintaining his respiratory status. A neurologist is consulted to assess for brain death. Which of the following tests is most crucial in confirming the diagnosis of brain death based on Harvard criteria?

options.label: A
options.text: Confirmatory MRI showing irreversible damage to the brainstem and cortex

options.label: B
options.text: Presence of apnea during an apnea test after appropriate oxygenation and CO₂ monitoring

options.label: C
options.text: Bilateral absence of pupillary light reflexes without pharmacological influence

options.label: D
options.text: Isoelectric EEG recorded for a continuous period of at least 24 hours

questions.correct_answer: B. Presence of apnea during an apnea test after appropriate oxygenation and CO₂ monitoring
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Brain death is a clinical diagnosis that requires unresponsiveness, absence of brainstem reflexes, and apnea confirmed by the apnea test. Confirmatory tests like EEG provide additional evidence but are not substitutes for clinical evaluation.
  • ➤ Brain death is a clinical diagnosis that requires unresponsiveness, absence of brainstem reflexes, and apnea confirmed by the apnea test.
  • ➤ Confirmatory tests like EEG provide additional evidence but are not substitutes for clinical evaluation.

questions.text: According to the latest AHA guidelines, what is the sixth link added to the "Chain of Survival"?

A team of epidemiologists is planning to conduct a survey on the prevalence of malnutrition in a village. What is the correct sequence of steps involved in the planning of this activity? Establishment of objectives and goals Fixing priorities Analysis of the health situation Assessment of resources

As part of the Food and Drug Administration drug approval process, a study is conducted to assess the clinical benefit and toxicity of a new drug that is intended to be used in combination with current standard chemotherapy for patients with recurrent glioblastoma. Fifty patients with recurrent glioblastoma enroll in the trial and are randomized to receive standard chemotherapy plus either placebo or 1 of 3 possible doses of the new drug. Study results show a dose-dependent reduction in tumor size with all 3 doses of the new drug, along with a significant increase in adverse drug effects, including hypertension, muscle weakness, lymphopenia, and hypophosphatemia. The researchers conclude that the middle dose of the new drug offers the greatest ratio of benefit to toxicity. Which of the following best describes this type of study?
A child came for DPT vaccination at 10 weeks with a past history of fever more than 40° C and inconsolable cry at 6 weeks following vaccination. What should be done next?

A 60-year-old obese male is scheduled for elective surgery under general anesthesia. He has a history of obstructive sleep apnea, hypertension, and a BMI of 35. Preoperative airway assessment is performed to determine if the patient has a difficult airway, as this could complicate the intubation process during the surgery. Based on the clinical tests, which of the following findings would classify this patient as having a "difficult airway"?

options.label: D
options.text: Upper lip bite test: Ability to protrude mandible

questions.text: Which of the following is not correct about management of Post-CPR Return of spontaneous circulation?

options.label: A
options.text: Targeted temperature management at 32 -36° C if patient is awake

options.label: D
options.text: Emergent cardiac intervention if STEMI present

questions.correct_answer: A. Targeted temperature management at 32 -36° C if patient is awake
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Targeted temperature management at 32 -36° C if patient is awake

questions.text: Identify the correct statements: Grade 2 disability per 10 lac population is the most important leprosy awareness indicator VVM shows cumulative exposure of the vaccine to the heat and assess vaccine efficacy Threonine and lysine are limiting amino acids in maize The external validity of a screening test is related to generalizability

A clinical study examines the usefulness of 5 different biomarkers to detect Barrett esophagus, the only known precursor lesion of esophageal adenocarcinoma. Researchers evaluate the performance of each biomarker and report the sensitivity, specificity, and area under the curve (AUC) estimates. Which is the most accurate biomarker?
HIV testing is done as screening in series. Which of the following will be true?

options.label: B
options.text: Sensitivity will decrease, specificity will increase

options.label: D
options.text: Sensitivity will increase, specificity will decrease

questions.correct_answer: B. Sensitivity will decrease, specificity will increase
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Sensitivity will decrease, specificity will increase

questions.text: Identify the correct statements FORD foundation is aiding in building toilets in India Normalcy of data can be measured by histogram, box-whisker plot and Shapiro-Wilk test Haddon matrix is a tool for prevention of injuries using epidemiology. Meta-analyses > RCT > Systematic review > Cohort > Case-control > expert opinion is the correct hierarchy for evidence

An 8-year-old girl is brought to the OPD for evaluation of a skin rash on her upper back. The rash is not painful but is mildly pruritic. She has no prior medical conditions, takes no medications, and is up to date with vaccinations. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's current condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Deep tissue invasion by normal skin flora

options.label: B
options.text: Epidermal damage from excessive sun exposure

questions.correct_answer: D. Microbial infection of keratinized structures

questions.text: Researchers at an academic trauma center conducted a randomized clinical trial comparing 2 surgical techniques (Technique A and Technique B) for repairing a mandible fracture. They examined rates of infectious complications and rates of malocclusion. A total of 100 patients were enrolled in the study. Results showed that the relative rate of infection with Technique A compared with Technique B was 0.86 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.57-1.28. What is a correct statement?

options.label: B
options.text: Technique A is superior to Technique B

options.label: C
options.text: Technique B is superior to Technique A

options.label: D
options.text: The techniques should not be used in a clinical care setting

questions.correct_answer: A. Neither surgery technique is superior
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Neither surgery technique is superior

questions.text: A 34-year-old male patient presented with pain and tightness on the glans penis and pigmentation with difficulty in urination. Examination finding is shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
True statement about Iron Isomaltoside 1000 is:

options.label: A
options.text: Iron requirement can be fulfilled in single dose

options.label: C
options.text: Given intravenously and gets deposited in adipose tissue therefore less toxic

questions.correct_answer: A. Iron requirement can be fulfilled in single dose
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Iron requirement can be fulfilled in single dose

questions.text: A 68-year-old lady was brought to the hospital by her daughter, with episodes of falls, confusion, chronic diarrhea, and cough. The intern decided to conduct a geriatric assessment. Which of the following factors indicated such an examination?
What is AMBU aura 40?
questions.correct_answer: A. First generation supraglottic airway device
questions.explanation: Ans. A) First generation supraglottic airway device

questions.text: A medical student is conducting a chart review of patients admitted to the local emergency department with acute pancreatitis. He is interested in comparing blood glucose levels between mild and severe cases. Blood glucose levels in patients with severe acute pancreatitis were found to have a strong positively skewed distribution. Which of the following is most likely to be true regarding the data for the severe acute pancreatitis group?

options.label: A
options.text: The mean is equal to the mode

options.label: B
options.text: The mean is greater than the median

options.label: C
options.text: The median is greater than the mean

options.label: D
options.text: The mode is greater than the mean

questions.correct_answer: B. The mean is greater than the median
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The mean is greater than the median

questions.text: You have gone to a village for screening where people have diabetes and hypertension. What type of screening is done for family members of these patients who show up in large numbers?
All of the following drugs cause adrenal suppression except:

A study is conducted to describe the age-sex distribution of a certain country. According to national data, the population pyramid of the country has the shape shown below. Which of the following is true?

options.label: A
options.text: The country seems to have high birth rates; therefore, the population must be growing

options.label: B
options.text: The country seems to have a high death rate; therefore, the population must be shrinking

options.label: C
options.text: The country seems to have a low birth rate; therefore, the population must be old

options.label: D
options.text: The country seems to have a short life expectancy; therefore, the population must be young

questions.correct_answer: C. The country seems to have a low birth rate; therefore, the population must be old
questions.explanation: Ans. C) The country seems to have a low birth rate; therefore, the population must be old

questions.text: How many total doses of DPT will a child receive by 2yrs of age according to NIS?

Which of the following statements is true about palliative care? A. Disease is the centre of concern B. The patient is sovereign C. Death should neither be prolonged nor hastened D. The aim is to improve the quality of life E. The intention is to cure F. Done when expected survival is <6months

A 34-year-old male is brought to the emergency department by his friends after being found unconscious. His friends report that he had been using heroin earlier in the day. On examination, the patient is unresponsive, his respiratory rate is 6 breaths per minute, pupils are pinpoint, and his oxygen saturation is 85% on room air. What is the most appropriate immediate management for this patient?

options.label: D
options.text: Provide oxygen via nasal cannula and monitor

questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The opioids are lethal in overdose.
  • ➤ The drug of choice for treatment of opioid overdose is i.v. naloxone (short-acting opioid antagonist).
  • ➤ drug of choice
  • ➤ i.v. naloxone

questions.text: A 60-year-old female presented with a great toe infection. She had a significant discoloration with a subungual hyperkeratosis that caused surface changes. She was suspected of having onychomycosis. Which is the topical drug given in toenail onychomycosis?
6 interventions in Anemia Mukt Bharat includes all except:

options.label: C
options.text: Testing for anemia using a digital hemoglobinometer

questions.text: A 4-year-old child is brought to the clinic with a 3-day history of fever, painful oral ulcers, and a rash affecting the hands and feet. The mother also reports that the child’s nails have started to peel off or appear abnormal in the past few days. What is the most likely nail finding associated with this condition?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Onychomadesis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Onychomadesis (painless nail shedding) is a recognized nail finding associated with Hand-Foot-Mouth Disease (HFMD), typically occurring 1–2 weeks after the onset of symptoms and resolving spontaneously.
  • ➤ Onychomadesis (painless nail shedding) is a recognized nail finding associated with Hand-Foot-Mouth Disease (HFMD), typically occurring 1–2 weeks after the onset of symptoms and resolving spontaneously.

questions.text: A large cohort study is conducted to assess the association between smoking and squamous cell carcinoma of the esophagus among middle-aged Chinese men. During 10 years of follow-up, smokers have 5 times the risk of esophageal carcinoma compared to non-smokers (relative risk = 5.0, 95% confidence interval = 2.9-7.1). According to the study results, what percentage of squamous cell carcinoma of the esophagus in smokers can be attributed to smoking?
In the Motivation model of health education, there are 3 stages of adoption of new ideas. What is the third one other than awareness & motivation?
Size of the laryngeal mask airway that can be used in a child weighing 19 kgs is ________.
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 2

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Select the correct size of the laryngeal mask airway (LMA) based on the child’s weight to ensure an effective and airtight seal for ventilation. Size 2 is suitable for children weighing 10-20 kg.

questions.text: A mother brought her 6-month-old infant baby to an Anganwadi worker Lata for advice regarding the vaccination of her child. The last vaccines he had received were OP V3, PENTA 3, TIP V2, and ROTA3 at 14 weeks of age. BCG and Hep B were given at birth. When is the next vaccination due?

options.label: A
options.text: MR vaccine at left arm intramuscularly and Vitamin A drops at the end of 9 months

options.label: B
options.text: MR vaccine at right arm subcutaneously and Vitamin A drops at the end of 8 months

options.label: C
options.text: MR vaccine at left arm intramuscularly and Vitamin A drops at the end of 8 months

options.label: D
options.text: MR vaccine at right arm subcutaneously and Vitamin A drops at the end of 9 months

questions.correct_answer: D. MR vaccine at right arm subcutaneously and Vitamin A drops at the end of 9 months
questions.explanation: Ans. D) MR vaccine at right arm subcutaneously and Vitamin A drops at the end of 9 months

questions.text: The image shown corresponds to which health program and disease:
Which of the following mental health conditions is not specifically targeted in the mhGAP intervention guidelines for non-specialized health care providers in low- and middle-income countries?

Universal health coverage (UHC) means that all people and communities receive the quality health service they need, without financial hardship. Which of the following are the challenges to implementing UHC?

options.label: A
options.text: Inequalities in the distribution, adequate support and access to quality assured products only in low-income settings

options.label: B
options.text: The purpose of UHC is to find a balance between countries’ income, health provision and financial burden

options.label: C
options.text: To provide healthcare to everyone regardless of the countries’ income

options.label: D
options.text: UHC only deals with financial aspect of health and cannot cover health provision to all

questions.correct_answer: C. To provide healthcare to everyone regardless of the countries’ income
questions.explanation: Ans. C) To provide healthcare to everyone regardless of the countries’ income

questions.text: A 30-year-old individual presents with multiple blistering skin lesions. A skin biopsy reveals acantholysis, characterized by the loss of adhesion between keratinocytes. Which of the following conditions is least likely to display acantholytic cells on histological examination?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Acantholysis, the loss of keratinocyte adhesion, is observed in conditions such as pemphigus, herpes simplex infection, and bullous impetigo, but not typically in Human papillomavirus (HPV) infection, which instead causes koilocytic changes.
  • ➤ Acantholysis, the loss of keratinocyte adhesion, is observed in conditions such as pemphigus, herpes simplex infection, and bullous impetigo, but not typically in Human papillomavirus (HPV) infection, which instead causes koilocytic changes.

questions.text: Which of the following groups is not included in this high-risk core population for HIV transmission?

options.label: C
options.text: Men who have sex with men

Identify the study scenario: A researcher planning to study the aetiologies of Multiple sclerosis.

A research laboratory is evaluating a new dipstick test for diagnosing urinary tract infections (UTls). The new test is compared to urinalysis of a midstream urine specimen (considered the diagnostic gold standard) to establish diagnostic test parameters. The study enrolls 300 patients, of which 100 have a UTI as determined by urinalysis. The new dipstick test is determined to be 70% sensitive and 90% specific for the diagnosis of UTl. How many false positives are present in the study?

In a population of 30,000, there were 500 live births & 14 stillbirths in the year 2023. There were 18 children that died before the age of 1 year, 12 before 28 days of life & among that, 9 died in the first 7 days of life. Calculate the early neonatal mortality rate?
An unconscious child presents to you with no pulse. ECG is as seen in the image. What is the next step in management?

options.label: B
options.text: Defibrillate, check rhythm and then start CPR

options.label: C
options.text: Defibrillate followed by CPR for 2 min, and check rhythm

options.label: D
options.text: Inject epinephrine and then start CPR

questions.correct_answer: C. Defibrillate followed by CPR for 2 min, and check rhythm
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Defibrillate followed by CPR for 2 min, and check rhythm

questions.text: A 3-minute-old newborn is being resuscitated due to signs of respiratory distress. Where should the clinical team place the pulse oximeter to measure oxygen saturation in this infant?

Which of the following statements is false regarding the following condition?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Associated with sclerodactyly and Raynaud’s phenomenon

options.label: C
options.text: The dermis is 3-4 times thicker than normal

options.label: D
options.text: Erythema and peau d'orange appearance of the skin can be seen

questions.correct_answer: B. Associated with sclerodactyly and Raynaud’s phenomenon
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Associated with sclerodactyly and Raynaud’s phenomenon

A district health officer is auditing malaria control activities under the NVBDCP. Which of the following tasks is not a responsibility of the District Malaria Officer?

options.label: A
options.text: Supervising Indoor Residual Spray (IRS) spraying operations

options.label: B
options.text: Managing case-based surveillance at the community level

options.label: C
options.text: Coordinating with the state government for procurement of IRS materials

options.label: D
options.text: Overseeing malaria inspectors and assistant malaria officers

questions.correct_answer: B. Managing case-based surveillance at the community level
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Managing case-based surveillance at the community level

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The District Malaria Officer oversees operational and logistical aspects of malaria control but does not directly manage community-level surveillance, which is the responsibility of MPWs and ASHAs.
  • ➤ The District Malaria Officer oversees operational and logistical aspects of malaria control but does not directly manage community-level surveillance, which is the responsibility of MPWs and ASHAs.

Free T4 levels are measured in 2 patient samples, one from a population of healthy patients without thyroid disease and one from a population of patients with hyperthyroidism. If the laboratory increases the upper limit of normal serum free T4 levels to 13 μg/dL, how would the sensitivity and specificity of free T4 level measurements for detecting hyperthyroidism in the samples change?

Match the following methods of mosquito control with their examples:
A drug classified as an inverse agonist at benzodiazepine receptors is likely to produce which of the following effects?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Inverse agonists reduce receptor activity below baseline, leading to excitatory effects like anxiety and seizures at benzodiazepine receptors.
  • ➤ Inverse agonists reduce receptor activity below baseline, leading to excitatory effects like anxiety and seizures at benzodiazepine receptors.

questions.text: Under NTEP 2020, which of the following is ICT enabled adherence system?
A 34-year-old patient presents with monkeypox and is started on tecovirimat for treatment. Which of the following best describes the mechanism of action of tecovirimat?

options.label: A
options.text: Inhibits the formation of intracellular viral forms of orthopoxviruses.

options.label: B
options.text: Targets the viral p37 protein, preventing viral envelopment and systemic spread.

options.label: C
options.text: Suppresses the replication of the variola virus within the host cell.

options.label: D
options.text: Inhibits viral entry into host cells by blocking the viral fusion protein.

questions.correct_answer: B. Targets the viral p37 protein, preventing viral envelopment and systemic spread.
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Targets the viral p37 protein, preventing viral envelopment and systemic spread.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Tecovirimat targets the orthopoxvirus p37 protein, inhibiting the envelopment of the virus and preventing the release of extracellular viral particles responsible for the systemic spread of the infection.
  • ➤ Tecovirimat targets the orthopoxvirus p37 protein, inhibiting the envelopment of the virus and preventing the release of extracellular viral particles responsible for the systemic spread of the infection.

questions.text: A laboratory is comparing two tests for measuring hemoglobin levels. Test A produces results as 10.5, 10.7,10.9,11.1g/dL, while Test B produces results as 9,11,13,15 g/dL. The true hemoglobin value is 13 g/dL. Which of the following is true regarding these tests?

options.label: A
options.text: Test A has higher validity but lower reliability compared to Test B.

options.label: B
options.text: Test A has higher reliability but lower validity compared to Test B.

options.label: C
options.text: Test A has both higher reliability and validity compared to Test B.

options.label: D
options.text: Test A has lower reliability and lower validity compared to Test B.

questions.correct_answer: B. Test A has higher reliability but lower validity compared to Test B.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Test A has higher reliability but lower validity compared to Test B.

questions.text: A 34-year-old patient presents with multiple soft, pedunculated skin lesions on the trunk. On palpation, these lesions are compressible and invaginate into the skin upon gentle pressure, creating a characteristic "button-hole" appearance. This finding is most commonly associated with which of the following conditions?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The button-hole sign, where lesions are compressible and invaginate into the skin upon pressure, is a characteristic clinical finding in neurofibromas . This is a hallmark feature of Neurofibromatosis type 1 (von Recklinghausen’s disease) , a genetic disorder caused by mutations in the NF1 gene.
  • ➤ The button-hole sign, where lesions are compressible and invaginate into the skin upon pressure, is a characteristic clinical finding in neurofibromas .
  • ➤ neurofibromas
  • ➤ This is a hallmark feature of Neurofibromatosis type 1 (von Recklinghausen’s disease) , a genetic disorder caused by mutations in the NF1 gene.
  • ➤ Neurofibromatosis type 1 (von Recklinghausen’s disease)

questions.text: Which of the following is the appropriate next step?

A 45-year-old male with Ischemic heart disease is posted for Coronary artery bypass graft surgery. You want beat to beat blood pressure measurement intraoperatively to guide you through the hemodynamic changes. Which among the following is the ideal artery for invasive blood pressure measurement?
Which of the following is not a feature of the triad of poikiloderma?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Skin hypertrophy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The triad of poikiloderma consists of skin atrophy, telangiectasia, and pigmentary changes. Skin hypertrophy is not part of this triad and suggests a different dermatological or systemic condition. This pattern is often seen in mycosis fungoides and other chronic dermatoses.
  • ➤ The triad of poikiloderma consists of skin atrophy, telangiectasia, and pigmentary changes. Skin hypertrophy is not part of this triad and suggests a different dermatological or systemic condition.
  • ➤ poikiloderma
  • ➤ skin atrophy, telangiectasia, and pigmentary changes.
  • ➤ Skin hypertrophy
  • ➤ This pattern is often seen in mycosis fungoides and other chronic dermatoses.
  • ➤ mycosis fungoides

questions.text: A 36-year-old man comes to the OPD due to bilateral skin lesions over the knees and elbows for the past several years. The patient says the lesions have enlarged progressively, which he attributes to excessive kneeling in his work as a plumber. The lesions are not painful but he has occasional itching. The patient has used several moisturizers, which provided only temporary relief. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's skin lesions?
Which is not an obvious advantage of the instrument shown below?
Which of the following interventions would be most effective in helping a country escape a demographic trap?

options.label: A
options.text: Increasing the availability of advanced medical care

options.label: B
options.text: Promoting the use of contraception and family planning

options.label: C
options.text: Improving economic opportunities in rural areas

options.label: D
options.text: Expanding immunization coverage for childhood diseases

questions.correct_answer: B. Promoting the use of contraception and family planning
questions.explanation:
Ans. B

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Promoting family planning and contraception is the most effective intervention to escape the demographic trap by reducing high fertility rates.
  • ➤ Promoting family planning and contraception is the most effective intervention to escape the demographic trap by reducing high fertility rates.

questions.text: A researcher is examining the relationship between socioeconomic status and IQ scores. The IQ scores of young Indian adults have historically been reported to be distributed normally with a mean of 100 and a standard deviation of 15. Initially, the researcher obtains a random sampling of 300 high school students from public schools nationwide and conducts IQ tests on all participants. Recently, the researcher received additional funding to enable an increase in sample size to 2,000 participants. Assuming that all other study conditions are held constant, which of the following is most likely to occur as a result of this additional funding?

options.label: A
options.text: Increase in range of the confidence interval

options.label: C
options.text: Decrease in standard error of the mean

options.label: D
options.text: Increase in risk of systematic error

questions.correct_answer: C. Decrease in standard error of the mean
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Decrease in standard error of the mean

questions.text: An 18 month old child is brought with no history of vaccination. From the following, which vaccines would be appropriate to give this child according to the National Immunization Schedule (NIS)?

options.label: D
options.text: DPT-1, OPV-1, Measles - 1, Vit.A – 1 lakh IU

questions.correct_answer: D. DPT-1, OPV-1, Measles - 1, Vit.A – 1 lakh IU
questions.explanation: Ans. D. DPT-1, OPV-1, Measles - 1, Vit.A – 1 lakh IU

questions.text: A pharmaceutical company conducts a cross-over study to compare the efficacy of two antihypertensive medications, Drug X and Drug Y. Participants receive Drug X for 4 weeks, undergo a 2-week washout period, and then receive Drug Y for 4 weeks. Upon analyzing the data, researchers observe that blood pressure measurements during the Drug Y phase are significantly lower than during the Drug X phase. However, they also note a progressive decrease in blood pressure readings over the entire study duration, irrespective of the treatment administered. Which of the following phenomena is most likely responsible for this observation?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Period effect

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cross-over studies, period effects can influence outcomes independently of the treatments being tested. Researchers must account for these effects to ensure accurate interpretation of results.
  • ➤ In cross-over studies, period effects can influence outcomes independently of the treatments being tested. Researchers must account for these effects to ensure accurate interpretation of results.

A 2-year-old undergoing chemotherapy for leukemia presents for vaccination counselling. Which of the following statements regarding live vaccines is accurate for this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Live vaccines are contraindicated even after chemotherapy is completed.

options.label: B
options.text: Live vaccines can be safely administered during chemotherapy as long as the patient is afebrile.

options.label: C
options.text: Live vaccines are contraindicated in immunocompromised states, but household contacts can safely receive them.

options.label: D
options.text: Live vaccines are contraindicated in leukemia patients only if they are in remission.

questions.correct_answer: C. Live vaccines are contraindicated in immunocompromised states, but household contacts can safely receive them.
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Live vaccines are contraindicated in immunocompromised states, but household contacts can safely receive them.

questions.text: In a public health survey conducted in rural Odisha, a 36-year-old woman is found to have a hemoglobin (Hb) level of 15.0 g/dl. This finding is particularly noteworthy as the survey data shows that the mean Hb level among the women in this area is 13.5 g/dl, with a standard deviation of 1.5 g/dl. questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Cold sores (herpes labialis) present with painful vesicular lesions around the mouth, often triggered by HSV-1, and can be associated with fever during reactivation.

questions.text: Given that the Total Fertility Rate (TFR) in India is 2.2, which of the following is the most likely estimate for the Crude Birth Rate (CBR)?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ To estimate the Crude Birth Rate (CBR) from the Total Fertility Rate (TFR) , use the formula:
  • ➤ To estimate the Crude Birth Rate (CBR) from the Total Fertility Rate (TFR) , use the formula:

  • ➤ Total Fertility Rate (TFR)

questions.text: A 3-month-old infant presents for vaccination, and the physician discusses options for rotavirus vaccines. Which of the following is a true statement regarding Rotarix and Rotavac vaccines?

options.label: A
options.text: Rotavac is a pentavalent vaccine targeting multiple serotypes of rotavirus.

options.label: B
options.text: Rotarix is a live attenuated monovalent vaccine targeting serotype G1P[8].

options.label: C
options.text: Both vaccines are subunit vaccines and administered intramuscularly.

options.label: D
options.text: Rotarix requires a three-dose schedule as per the National Immunization Schedule.

questions.correct_answer: B. Rotarix is a live attenuated monovalent vaccine targeting serotype G1P[8].

questions.text: A male patient presents with a history of foot trauma followed by a left toenail infection. He is diagnosed with onychomycosis and shows improvement after treatment with terbinafine. Which part of the nail is primarily affected by this condition?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Onychomycosis (Tinea unguium) primarily affects the nail plate, leading to nail thickening, discoloration, and dystrophy. Treatment typically involves antifungal medications such as terbinafine.
  • ➤ Onychomycosis (Tinea unguium) primarily affects the nail plate, leading to nail thickening, discoloration, and dystrophy.
  • ➤ Treatment typically involves antifungal medications such as terbinafine.

questions.text: A 56-year-old male soldier presents for a routine examination. He has been on combination antiretroviral therapy (CART) for the past 2 weeks and expresses a desire to discontinue his HIV treatment. He complains of dizziness and strange nightmares that began after starting the therapy. Which of the following medications is the most likely cause of his symptoms?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Efavirenz

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Recognize Efavirenz as the antiretroviral agent most associated with CNS side effects , including vivid dreams and dizziness. Understand that CNS symptoms are most prominent during the initial weeks of therapy and may resolve over time. Emphasize the importance of counseling patients regarding potential side effects to improve medication adherence.
  • ➤ Recognize Efavirenz as the antiretroviral agent most associated with CNS side effects , including vivid dreams and dizziness.
  • ➤ Efavirenz
  • ➤ CNS side effects
  • ➤ Understand that CNS symptoms are most prominent during the initial weeks of therapy and may resolve over time.
  • ➤ Emphasize the importance of counseling patients regarding potential side effects to improve medication adherence.

questions.text: A 4-month-old girl is brought to the clinic by her parents for a well-child check. She was evaluated 2 weeks ago for a rash in the diaper area. At that visit, the patient was found to have erythematous papules in the diaper area that spared the skin folds. Her symptoms improved with use of a petrolatum barrier ointment with every diaper change. Today, vital signs and physical examination are normal. Which of the following most likely contributed to this patient's prior skin findings?
A study calculated the correlation coefficient between smoking and lung cancer incidence as 1.4. What does this result indicate?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Mistake in calculation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Correlation coefficients must fall between -1 and +1. A value outside this range, such as 1.4, suggests a calculation error.
  • ➤ Correlation coefficients must fall between -1 and +1. A value outside this range, such as 1.4, suggests a calculation error.

questions.text: A district in Madhya Pradesh has CBR 19/1000 LB and CDR is 6/1000 LB. Find the annual growth rate of the district.
Which of these is the correct sequence of Maslow's hierarchy of needs?

options.label: A
options.text: Safety - Physiological needs - Self actualization - Belonging - Self esteem

options.label: B
options.text: Physiological needs - Safety - Belonging - Self esteem - Self actualization

options.label: C
options.text: ﻿Safety - Self actualization - Belonging - Physiological needs - Self esteem

options.label: D
options.text: Self actualization - Safety - belonging - Self esteem

questions.correct_answer: B. Physiological needs - Safety - Belonging - Self esteem - Self actualization
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Physiological needs - Safety - Belonging - Self esteem - Self actualization

questions.text: A study is conducted to investigate the relationship between smoking and lung cancer. The findings suggest that the association between smoking and lung cancer is stronger in individuals who exercise less and weaker in individuals who exercise more. In this case, exercise is considered:
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ An effect modifier is a variable that alters the strength or direction of the association between an exposure (like smoking) and an outcome (like lung cancer). In studies, an effect modifier can highlight how the relationship between the primary exposure and outcome differs across levels or subgroups of the modifier.
  • ➤ An effect modifier is a variable that alters the strength or direction of the association between an exposure (like smoking) and an outcome (like lung cancer).
  • ➤ effect modifier
  • ➤ In studies, an effect modifier can highlight how the relationship between the primary exposure and outcome differs across levels or subgroups of the modifier.

questions.text: A 45-year-old gardener presents to the clinic with a 2-week history of painless nodular lesions on his left forearm. He recalls pricking his hand on a thorn while trimming rose bushes 3 weeks ago. The lesions began as a small papule on his hand and have since spread proximally along the forearm in a linear pattern. He denies fever, chills, or systemic symptoms. The image of the lesion is shown below. Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment for this condition?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Itraconazole

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Sporotrichosis is a subcutaneous fungal infection often associated with traumatic inoculation during gardening. The typical presentation includes nodular lesions spreading along lymphatics, and itraconazole is the first-line treatment for lymphocutaneous sporotrichosis.
  • ➤ Sporotrichosis is a subcutaneous fungal infection often associated with traumatic inoculation during gardening.
  • ➤ The typical presentation includes nodular lesions spreading along lymphatics, and itraconazole is the first-line treatment for lymphocutaneous sporotrichosis.

questions.text: A clinical trial evaluates the safety profile of a new medication compared to a placebo in preventing adverse events. The study enrolled 20,000 participants, evenly randomized into two groups (new drug vs. placebo). After one year of follow-up, 2000 participants in the new drug group and 1500 participants in the placebo group experienced adverse events. Based on these findings, which of the following is the number needed to harm (NNH)?

A child presents with orangish hue skin with rough and scaly skin as shown in the image. There is hyperkeratosis of palms. Ortho and parakeratosis is seen in histopathology. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 7-year-old HIV-positive child with a CD4 count of 320 cells/mm³ and WHO stage 3 clinical status has been initiated on cotrimoxazole prophylaxis. When should prophylaxis be discontinued in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: When the child reaches 10 years of age, irrespective of ART adherence.

options.label: B
options.text: When the CD4 count exceeds 350 cells/mm³, and the child has been on ART for at least 6 months.

options.label: C
options.text: Cotrimoxazole prophylaxis should continue indefinitely for all HIV-positive children.

options.label: D
options.text: Discontinuation should occur only when the child demonstrates undetectable viral loads for over 12 months.

questions.correct_answer: B. When the CD4 count exceeds 350 cells/mm³, and the child has been on ART for at least 6 months.
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cotrimoxazole prophylaxis in HIV-positive children older than 5 years can be discontinued when the CD4 count is >350 cells/mm³, and ART has been effective for at least 6 months.
  • ➤ Cotrimoxazole prophylaxis in HIV-positive children older than 5 years can be discontinued when the CD4 count is >350 cells/mm³, and ART has been effective for at least 6 months.

questions.text: A public health campaign increases vaccination rates against HPV 16 and 18. Increased vaccination rates would have which of the following effects on the Papanicolaou test?

A 65-year-old male with metastatic lung cancer is enrolled in a clinical trial comparing the effectiveness of two new chemotherapy regimens on overall survival. The study monitors patients for five years, and survival data is presented using Kaplan-Meier curves. Which statistical test is most appropriate to determine if there is a significant difference in survival between the two groups?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Cox proportional hazards model is used in survival analysis to compare the hazard rates between groups while accounting for covariates.
  • ➤ The Cox proportional hazards model is used in survival analysis to compare the hazard rates between groups while accounting for covariates.
